abstract: NCAA ends its 13-month investigation into Auburn's football program, clearing university of any major violations stemming from its recruitment of Heisman Trophy-winning quarterback Cam Newton; Auburn is allowed to keep its 2010 Bowl Championship Series title.
snippet: The N.C.A.A. said it could reopen the investigation, but the Tigers will be able to keep their 2010 Bowl Championship Series title.
lead_paragraph: The N.C.A.A. said it could reopen the investigation, but the Tigers will be able to keep their 2010 Bowl Championship Series title.

headline.main: Auburn Is Cleared in Investigation Into Newton
headline.print_headline: Auburn Is Cleared in Investigation Into Newton
headline.seo: Auburn Is Cleared in Investigation Into Cam Newton’s Recruitment
